data.title: Tilemap : One way collision on a tile
data.body:
I use a StaticBody2D with a CollisionPolygon2D to have a "one way collision" , and works fine.

Make the same thing for a tile in my tileset, and not works, tile is Solid. "One way Collision" in the StaticBody2D on my tile dont make nothing.

Possible to have the same thing ? :)

data.title: [OSX Clang] Fix parentheses-equality warnings
data.body:
Fixed this warning
`warning: equality comparison with extraneous parentheses [-Wparentheses-equality]`

Tested on LLVM Clang 7.0.0

data.title: SpatialSamplePlayer Looped voices get overwritten while playing
data.body:
I added a long sample that takes several seconds to play, and a short sample that takes about a quarter of a second to play.  If I set polyphony to 3, and play the long sample, then start playing the short sample every half a second, the third short sample kills the long sample.  By the time this short sample plays, both the previous short samples are finished playing, and those voice IDs should be available for re-use.  The fact that it overwrites the non-finished voice while there are other voices available for use sounds like a bug to me.

This problem was initially discovered while attempting to get one voice to play in a loop while other voices filled in as requested. The looped voice gets overwritten after x number of sounds have played, with x being the number of voices.

data.title: Changing the properties of an instanced scene, from the editor
data.body:
Let's say I have am Item scene, which contains a Node2D as the root, and a Sprite (with multiple frames, from a spritesheet) as a child, among other stuff.
And I make multiple instances of Item.

Can I set the Frame property of different instances separately from the editor, or do I have to call get_node("ItemN/Sprite").set_frame(n) for each instance of Item using script?

If the answer is "yes, setting from the editor should work", well, it only looks like it's working inside the editor but when I run the game, it doesn't.

If the answer is no, then it shouldn't show different frames inside the editor too (which is quite misleading), right?

Either way, there is a problem.

data.title: Re-import menu doesn't show recently added resources
data.body:
When I add a new font, it doesn't show up in the re-import menu.
It shows up after I restart godot though.

data.title: After installation file is getting force closed on windows 10 64bit
data.body:
I have downloaded the game engine binary files and tried running it, but on run stage the shell command gets executed and directly after that i get a message from the OS that the file has stop working. Its happening all the time, i tried downloading the fresh copy multiple time as well but that's of no use.

Looking forward to hear back from you.

data.title: Crash when Child is Removed during Connected Function
data.body:
If you've got some child which is connected to one of your functions, and you remove that child during the course of the function call, the application crashes without gracefully returning to the editor. The simplest code demonstration would be the following Node code, to which the Button child's "pressed" is connected:

```
func _on_Button_pressed():
    var button = get_node("Button")
    remove_child(button)
```

An example project can be found at http://www.godotengine.org/attachments/640/Example.zip

data.title: extends test should be silent
data.body:
When an object is `null` or of built-in type, the test `* extends *` should not raise `left operand of 'extends' is not an instance of anything`. 
That is not a syntax error, the result should just be `false`.
The value's type must be compared to TYPE_NIL and TYPE_OBJECT before to use extends, thus this error is useless.

data.title: Collision not aligned to tile if the sprite pivot is not centered
data.body:
~~You can see the problem here: http://godotengine.org/topics/12370?r=12390 It would be helpful if the _Y Sort_ option in **TileMap** could work with a custom pivot.
For example, I could add a **Position2D** node to my tile sprite before converting it to a tileset. Then **TileMap** could use it instead of the sprite's pivot (just for the _Y Sort_ option, of course). If omitted then it could use the sprite pivot by default, like it does now.~~

I renamed this issue since it looks the actual problem is a different one (read comments below).

data.title: nested clipping of canvas items now works
data.body: Fixes https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/issues/2571

data.title: label no longer clipped by scroll container
data.body:
Put a label inside a scroll container, and it won't be clipped by the scroll container's edges.  Sprites, for example, are still clipped.  Strangely, when opening an existing project with multiple labels as descendants on the scroll container, only some of the labels behave this way.  Others are clipped correctly.

Example project:
https://copy.com/jtp0XccvYj8qcfNa

data.title: Need to reset terminal colors to the original setting when outputting error to the terminal.
data.body:
^[[1;31;40mERROR: cleanup: ^[[1;37;40mObjectDB Instances still exist!
^[[0;31;40m   At: core/object.cpp:1853.^[[0;0;37m

This leaves the terminal color, i.e. the prompt white instead of red or green or blue or any color you had for your prompt before Godot wrote an error message to the terminal.

data.body: "scons p=windows" failed to build on the Visual Studio 2013 command prompt on windows due to two small errors introduced by the recent opus addition.

data.title: Add support for Opus audio format
data.body:
Tested on Linux, Windows, Android and Javascript. I can't test for other platforms, but I'm able to cross-compile for OS X and iPhone.

Closes #1706.

data.title: removed extra viewport clear
data.body: Removed unnecessary clear, which prevented root viewport from working right when told not to clear.

data.title: Avoid stealing focus on mouse hover if focus owner is a text field
data.body:
Using many _cast_to_ for both _LineEdit_ and _TextEdit_ looked ugly so I added a **text_field** (could be named retain_focus instead?) member flag to _Control_. It should make it simpler if adding new text field like controls later. Closes #2473

There may be a better way to do this, if you don't want that new variable in Control.

data.body:
Im having this problem when I try to open files edited in another computer.

Im working with a team, I started a project, pushed it to a repo and after my coworker edited it, its permission changed but even if i add the permissions im getting this error.

Im running the latest stable version, im running under Debian 8.

data.title: Extraordinary number of draw calls for 3d particle emitter
data.body:
_Bugsquad edit:_ Seen in 1.1 stable as well as 2.0 alpha ae3d4ac193a261c8bed28e22304ccfa2c86ccf48

The amount of draw calls for 3d particle emitter is directly related to number of particles. (300 particles == 300 draw calls). Also these draw calls are in power even if emitter is not emitting any particles (emit = false).
It's little troublesome since the only way to make explosion with 3d particle emitter is to set hight number of particles with small "emit timeout" parameter... 
Sample project: https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/168251/godot/some/issues/3DParticleDrawCalls.7z

data.title: Script editor doesn't recognize ".gd" extension
data.body:
I just built and started using the most recent source on github. I added a node to one of my scenes and attached a new script to it. I created the script by going to the "Script" heading in the node's inspector, selecting "New GDScript", then selecting Edit. When I went to save the script I tried to save it as "myScript.gd", and got an alert from the editor that said "File format requested unknown: gd". Upon further inspection, my script is being saved to memory somewhere because when I quit and reopen the project it's still there, but its being named something like "GDScript (11111)" and not in my project folder anywhere. I can still open my other scripts (all with the ".gd" extension) and edit/save them without any problems at all. I can also create a script by going to the script tab first and setting it's path there. Then I can add it to a node with the Load option without problems.

I'm running ubuntu 14.04 on a 64-bit laptop, if that changes anything.
